systems.title: üíª openSUSE Tumbleweed
systems.description: Desktop computer with high-end computer hardware
systems.reason: Distro hopping led me here. Tumbleweed has worked great for me ever since I switched from Windows, and supports everything needed for software development, gaming and general usage.

systems.title: üñ•Ô∏è Debian 12
systems.description: Home server hosting multiple instances of personal cloud and media services. Raid 5 planned in the future.
systems.reason: Debian is perhaps not the most up to date distro, but it is stable. Inherently well tested software, solid reliability. Debian's wide software support can be matched with Ubuntu, despite not being a Cannonical product.

systems.title: üñ•Ô∏è Ubuntu 22.04
systems.description: Virtual Private Server hosting my projects
systems.reason: Ubuntu is the best supported and most used distribution in the cloud infrastructure world (citation needed). It's uncomplicated.

systems.title: üíª EndeavourOS
systems.description: Laptop for studying and work on the go
systems.reason: Arch User Repository. The all powerful source of all kinds of niche packages a software developer could ever need. Also having up to date packages is very beneficial in an environment with emerging technologies around every corner.

cars.title: 2008 Subaru Outback
cars.description: BP Legacy/Outbacks are the best looking wagons, and I love mine. I'd love to put it on coilovers and upgrade the anti-roll bars

cars.title: 1987 Mercedes 230E
cars.description: E-class W124 with the modest 2.3L engine. Gorgeous car and a superb driving experience. Needs some rust and paint work done, and some idling improvements.
